column1: #Text=The polycrystalline samples of CeCoSi and its nonmagnetic\rcounterpart LaCoSi were synthesized from elemental Ce\r(La), Co, and Si materials mixed in stoichiometric ratios using\rarc-melting technique, and then annealed for ∼2 weeks at a\rtemperature close to 1200◦C (the details are given in [9]).
#Text=The\rresulting materials were examined using x-ray powder diffraction\rand energy dispersive x-ray spectroscopy analysis (EDX).

#Text=The EDX measurements have shown that, after the annealing,\rthe majority of the sample consists of the CeCoSi phase, with\ra small inclusion of an elemental Ce and CeCo2Si2 phase, but according to powder diffraction, the concentration of impurity\rphases is below 2%.
